title: Football news: Crystal Palace 'target Rangers striker Alfredo Morelos in £20m January move'
text:
Crystal Palace are eyeing a £20million January move for Alfredo Morelos.

The Selhurst Park side have been tracking the Rangers striker ahead of a possible bid, although they will have to compete with Premier League rivals Aston Villa for his signature.

According to the Sun, Palace's sporting director Dougie Freedman was in attendance at Hearts' Tynecastle ground on Sunday.

Crystal Palace are eyeing a £20million January transfer window move for Alfredo Morelos

He watched on as Morelos struck for Rangers in the Scottish Premiership clash.

Scouts had identified the 23-year-old as a target for January and Freedman wanted to cast his eyes over the Colombian.

Palace are also eyeing a move for Chelsea striker Olivier Giroud in January.

The Selhurst Park side have been tracking the Rangers striker ahead of a possible bid

Freedman was not alone in watching Morelos, with Villa sending one of their scouts to take in the game.

When their manager Dean Smith was asked about Morelos, who has hit 15 goals already this season, he said people should 'watch this space'.

Rangers will not be keen to lose the hitman, who is helping them challenge Celtic for the title under Steven Gerrard.
